snippet: Former military officers and civilian officials who defended the administration’s strategy in Afghanistan worry efforts to train and advise Afghan security forces will be curtailed.
abstract: Former military officers and civilian officials who worked to develop and defend Obama administration’s strategy in Afghanistan are joining criticism of president's announcement that American forces will leave Afghanistan by the end of 2016; worry is that withdrawal schedule is so rigid and compressed that it will curtail efforts to train and advise Afghan security forces.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Former military officers and civilian officials who defended the administration’s strategy in Afghanistan worry efforts to train and advise Afghan security forces will be curtailed.

headline.main: Criticism Over Troop Withdrawal Emerges From Beyond G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Criticism Over Troop Withdrawal Emerges From Beyond G.O.P.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
